{"id":1311632512,"question_id":3463,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"7Â months","timestamp":1720276786,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1311632512/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Alternating Groups I","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int numberOfAlternatingGroups(vector<int>& colors) { //colors[i] == 0 means that tile i is red.\n                                                        //colors[i] == 1 means that tile i is blue\n        unsigned int sz = colors.size();\n        if(sz<3)\n            return 0;\n        \n        int ans = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<=sz; i++) {\n            if(colors[i] != colors[(i-1)%sz] && colors[i] != colors[(i+1)%sz])\n                ans++;\n        }\n        \n        return ans;\n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"alternating-groups-i","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
